A **shuriken** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The shuriken is a hand-[thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **throwing star** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

## Generation

Shuriken are quite rare, making up 3.5% of randomly-generated weapons - this amounts to 0.35% of all randomly found objects in the main dungeon, 0.42% of all items on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"), and 0.7% of all items in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and melee roles ([Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), and [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")) start the game with knowledge of the shuriken's appearance.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Ninja have a 3⁄4 chance of [generating with a stack of shuriken](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory"), and will otherwise receive a stack of [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Monk](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄3 chance of a stack of shuriken replacing the melee weapon they are generated with, and will otherwise generate with no melee weapon.[\[3\]](#cite_note-monsndx-3)

## Shuriken skill

| Shuriken |                                                                                                                                   |
| -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max      | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                         |
| Basic    | - [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") |
| Skilled  | * [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                                  |
| Expert   | - [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")                                                                                              |

Shuriken are the only weapons to use the **shuriken [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill")**, and there are no [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") shuriken. The skill can only be trained by throwing the shuriken.

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), ninja and player monster monks gain a +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") bonus when throwing shuriken.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Description

Shuriken gain a +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus when thrown. They can [mulch](/wiki/Mulch "Mulch") upon hitting monsters like some other projectiles, and can be [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison") by [dipping](/wiki/Dipping "Dipping") them in a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness").

## Strategy

Each shuriken weighs only 1 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") similar to [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), and their damage when thrown eclipses that of [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") - they are stellar weapons to enchant and poison (especially if you are not [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful")), and are best employed against dangerous melee-range threats such as [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer"). Their to-hit bonus can also help offset the penalty for throwing them at [Unskilled](/wiki/Unskilled "Unskilled").

In practice, the shuriken's rarity makes it difficult to train the skill or make long-term use of them without [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling"); a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") can be used to either procure a stack of shuriken directly, or more commonly to obtain something for polypiling them with (e.g. a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")). Samurai are the primary exception to this "rule", as ninja generate exclusively in the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest") and often carry shuriken - this makes it easier for Samurai characters to assemble and enchant a stockpile and train the skill to Expert, especially with high [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck").

### Skill levels

Of the other three roles that can attain Skilled in shuriken, [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") can also reach Skilled in daggers and [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), as well as Expert in darts - all three are far more common, but generally deal less damage and are overall heavier to carry; darts are the only option of those three that can be poisoned and multishot, and are just as light as shuriken. [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") gain multishot bonuses with arrows and many other projectiles, as do [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") using daggers, and will often prefer the more accessible ranged options.

Monks are in a unique situation compared to the other roles: they can only reach Basic in shuriken, but their role-specific multishot bonus makes it their best non-melee weapon by far - of the other options available, [spears](/wiki/Spear "Spear") are generally heavy, and [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") require that the character keep a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") wielded. [Weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") Monks may consider enchanting and blessing any shuriken they find or even polypiling for them, which provides one of the [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct")'s few uses for the [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon").

## History

The shuriken is first introduced in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") alongside the Samurai and the now-defunct [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja_\(role\) "Ninja (role)") role. Samurai from NetHack 1.3d to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10") start the game with a stack of up to 9 shuriken that may be blessed;[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) Ninja from NetHack 1.3d to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e") start the game with up to 25 shuriken.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Shuriken](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuriken "wikipedia:Shuriken")***

A shuriken (手裏剣, literally "hidden hand blade") is a Japanese concealed weapon used to distract or misdirect enemies. Though they are also known in Western cultures as throwing stars, or ninja stars, they were originally designed in many different shapes - there are a few major varieties of shuriken such as the dart-like *bō shuriken* (棒手裏剣, "stick shuriken"), with the star-shaped ones being known as *hira shuriken* (平手裏剣, "flat shuriken") or *shaken* (車剣, "wheel shuriken"). The curriculum of many famous swordsmanship and martial arts schools taught the art of wielding shuriken, and they were often seen as important tactical supplements to the sword or various other weapons in a samurai's arsenal.

## Variants

Some variants adjust the skill caps for shuriken and/or make them easier to obtain through certain methods.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnoll shamans](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman") always generate with a stack of roughly a dozen shuriken.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") add shuriken to [the expanded list](/wiki/Samurai#dNetHack "Samurai") of [Japanese item names](/wiki/Samurai#Japanese_names_for_items "Samurai"), and they will appear as "hira-shuriken" to Samurai; of note is that darts are called "bo-shuriken" for Samurai.

[The Earth Crystal](/wiki/The_Earth_Crystal "The Earth Crystal") increases a character's skill cap for shuriken by 1 while carried. [Astaroth](/wiki/Astaroth "Astaroth") is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that grants skill in shuriken while bound, and one of his active powers can fire a barrage of shuriken in random directions at the cost of some health.

If a character has [morgul](/index.php?title=Morgul\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Morgul (page does not exist)") shards embedded in them, they can pay a non-hostile [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") 4000 [zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") to extract the shards from them: each shard removed creates a [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal") shuriken with the "lesser morgul" [object property](/wiki/Object_properties#dNetHack "Object properties").

Some monsters can be generated with shuriken:

- [Garo](/wiki/Garo "Garo") may be generated with a stack of shuriken, and the unique [garo master](/wiki/Garo_master "Garo master") always generates carrying shuriken.
- [Maids](/wiki/Maid "Maid") may generate with a stack of shuriken for non-Samurai characters.
- [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen") will generate with a stack of up to 48 [golden](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)") shuriken.

The [Fuma-itto no Ken](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Fuma-itto_no_Ken "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to [create shuriken](/wiki/Create_ammo "Create ammo").

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), Monks can reach expert in shuriken.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), shuriken appear as **razor cards** for [Cartomancers](/wiki/Cartomancer "Cartomancer").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Wizards no longer have the shuriken skill.

Stacks of shuriken can be given to a player as a "minor" gift from their [god](/wiki/God "God") via [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"), and gifted shuriken will be erodeproofed and often enchanted - Monks that maintain weaponless conduct will almost always receive shuriken when given a gift this way as opposed to standard armor and weapons, with the exception of [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact").

3-4 shuriken can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining 2 darts and a dagger.

Most roles have fairly early access to forging components for shuriken, and characters that are played patiently can create stockpiles of shuriken made of specific [materials](/wiki/Object_materials_\(EvilHack\) "Object materials (EvilHack)") and/or possessing specific [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), shuriken are known by different names to Samurai and Ninja, similar to dNetHack: "standard" shuriken appear as "hira-shuriken", while darts are called "bo-shuriken".

SlashTHEM also adds the Fuma-itto no Ken from dNetHack, which retains its invoke ability and acts as the [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the revived Ninja role.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to EvilHack forging recipes, 2 shuriken can be combined with an [iron chain](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain") at a forge to create a [spiked chain](/wiki/Spiked_chain "Spiked chain").

## Encyclopedia entry

You know, that's what I hate most about fighting against magic:  
you never know what they're trying to do to you until it hits.  
The sorceress knew what hit her, however. Two of the shuriken  
got past whatever defenses she had. One caught her just below  
the throat, the other in the middle of her chest. It wouldn't  
kill her, but she wouldn't be fighting anyone for a while.

\[ Jhereg, by Steven Brust ]

A shuriken is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. The shuriken is a hand-thrown stackable projectile that is made of iron, and appears as a throwing star when unidentified.

A '''shuriken''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. The shuriken is a hand-[[thrown]] [[stackable]] [[projectile]] that is made of [[iron]], and appears as a '''throwing star''' when [[identification|unidentified]].

==Generation==
Shuriken are quite rare, making up 3.5% of randomly-generated weapons - this amounts to 0.35% of all randomly found objects in the main dungeon, 0.42% of all items on the [[Rogue level]], and 0.7% of all items in [[Gehennom]].

[[Monk]]s and melee roles ([[Barbarian]]s, [[Knight]]s, [[Samurai]], and [[Valkyrie]]s) start the game with knowledge of the shuriken's appearance.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|723|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=starting knowledge for monks}}

Ninja have a {{frac|3|4}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|generating with a stack of shuriken]], and will otherwise receive a stack of [[dart]]s.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|267|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Monk (player monster)|Monk]] [[player monster]]s, including those generated on the [[Astral Plane]] have a {{frac|3}} chance of a stack of shuriken replacing the melee weapon they are generated with, and will otherwise generate with no melee weapon.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|205|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name=monsndx}}

==Shuriken skill==
{{shuriken skill table}}

Shuriken are the only weapons to use the '''shuriken [[skill]]''', and there are no [[artifact]] shuriken. The skill can only be trained by throwing the shuriken.

[[Monk]]s, ninja and player monster monks gain a +1 [[multishot]] bonus when throwing shuriken.{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|143|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/mthrowu.c|204|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/mthrowu.c|216|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
Shuriken gain a +2 [[to-hit]] bonus when thrown. They can [[mulch]] upon hitting monsters like some other projectiles, and can be [[poison]]ed by [[dipping]] them in a [[potion of sickness]].

==Strategy==
Each shuriken weighs only 1 [[aum]] similar to [[dart]]s, and their damage when thrown eclipses that of [[dagger]]s - they are stellar weapons to enchant and poison (especially if you are not [[lawful]]), and are best employed against dangerous melee-range threats such as [[mind flayer]]s. Their to-hit bonus can also help offset the penalty for throwing them at [[Unskilled]].

In practice, the shuriken's rarity makes it difficult to train the skill or make long-term use of them without [[polypiling]]; a [[wish]] can be used to either procure a stack of shuriken directly, or more commonly to obtain something for polypiling them with (e.g. a [[wand of polymorph]]). Samurai are the primary exception to this "rule", as ninja generate exclusively in the [[Samurai quest]] and often carry shuriken - this makes it easier for Samurai characters to assemble and enchant a stockpile and train the skill to Expert, especially with high [[luck]].

===Skill levels===
Of the other three roles that can attain Skilled in shuriken, [[Healer]]s can also reach Skilled in daggers and [[sling]], as well as Expert in darts - all three are far more common, but generally deal less damage and are overall heavier to carry; darts are the only option of those three that can be poisoned and multishot, and are just as light as shuriken. [[Ranger]]s gain multishot bonuses with arrows and many other projectiles, as do [[Rogue]]s using daggers, and will often prefer the more accessible ranged options.

Monks are in a unique situation compared to the other roles: they can only reach Basic in shuriken, but their role-specific multishot bonus makes it their best non-melee weapon by far - of the other options available, [[spear]]s are generally heavy, and [[crossbow bolt]]s require that the character keep a [[crossbow]] wielded. [[Weaponless]] Monks may consider enchanting and blessing any shuriken they find or even polypiling for them, which provides one of the [[conduct]]'s few uses for the [[scroll of enchant weapon]].

==History==
The shuriken is first introduced in [[NetHack 1.3d]] alongside the Samurai and the now-defunct [[Ninja (role)|Ninja]] role. Samurai from NetHack 1.3d to [[NetHack 3.0.10]] start the game with a stack of up to 9 shuriken that may be blessed;{{refsrc|u_init.c|200|nethack=3.0.0}}<ref>NetHack 3.0.10 u_init.c, line 206</ref> Ninja from NetHack 1.3d to [[NetHack 2.3e]] start the game with up to 25 shuriken.{{refsrc|u_init.c|184|nethack=2.3e}}{{refsrc|u_init.c|200|nethack=3.0.0}}

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Shuriken}}
A shuriken (手裏剣, literally "hidden hand blade") is a Japanese concealed weapon used to distract or misdirect enemies. Though they are also known in Western cultures as throwing stars, or ninja stars, they were originally designed in many different shapes - there are a few major varieties of shuriken such as the dart-like ''bō shuriken'' (棒手裏剣, "stick shuriken"), with the star-shaped ones being known as ''hira shuriken'' (平手裏剣, "flat shuriken") or ''shaken'' (車剣, "wheel shuriken"). The curriculum of many famous swordsmanship and martial arts schools taught the art of wielding shuriken, and they were often seen as important tactical supplements to the sword or various other weapons in a samurai's arsenal.

==Variants==
Some variants adjust the skill caps for shuriken and/or make them easier to obtain through certain methods.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[gnoll shaman]]s always generate with a stack of roughly a dozen shuriken.{{refsrc|makemon.c|718|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]] add shuriken to [[Samurai#dNetHack|the expanded list]] of [[Samurai#Japanese names for items|Japanese item names]], and they will appear as "hira-shuriken" to Samurai; of note is that darts are called "bo-shuriken" for Samurai.

[[The Earth Crystal]] increases a character's skill cap for shuriken by 1 while carried. [[Astaroth]] is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that grants skill in shuriken while bound, and one of his active powers can fire a barrage of shuriken in random directions at the cost of some health.

If a character has [[morgul]] shards embedded in them, they can pay a non-hostile [[nurse]] 4000 [[zm]] to extract the shards from them: each shard removed creates a [[metal]] shuriken with the "lesser morgul" [[Object properties#dNetHack|object property]].

Some monsters can be generated with shuriken:

* [[Garo]] may be generated with a stack of shuriken, and the unique [[garo master]] always generates carrying shuriken.
* [[Maid]]s may generate with a stack of shuriken for non-Samurai characters.
* [[Master Kaen]] will generate with a stack of up to 48 [[Gold (material)|golden]] shuriken. 

The [[dNetHack artifacts#Fuma-itto no Ken|Fuma-itto no Ken]] is an [[artifact]] can be [[invoked]] to [[Create ammo|create shuriken]].

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], Monks can reach expert in shuriken.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], shuriken appear as '''razor cards''' for [[Cartomancer]]s.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], Wizards no longer have the shuriken skill.

Stacks of shuriken can be given to a player as a "minor" gift from their [[god]] via [[sacrifice]], and gifted shuriken will be erodeproofed and often enchanted - Monks that maintain weaponless conduct will almost always receive shuriken when given a gift this way as opposed to standard armor and weapons, with the exception of [[artifact]]s.

3-4 shuriken can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining 2 darts and a dagger. 

Most roles have fairly early access to forging components for shuriken, and characters that are played patiently can create stockpiles of shuriken made of specific [[Object materials (EvilHack)|materials]] and/or possessing specific [[object properties]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], shuriken are known by different names to Samurai and Ninja, similar to dNetHack: "standard" shuriken appear as "hira-shuriken", while darts are called "bo-shuriken".

SlashTHEM also adds the Fuma-itto no Ken from dNetHack, which retains its invoke ability and acts as the [[quest artifact]] for the revived Ninja role.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], in addition to EvilHack forging recipes, 2 shuriken can be combined with an [[iron chain]] at a forge to create a [[spiked chain]].
